plugins.name: Property Toggle
plugins.description:
Property Toggle lets you quickly set boolean (true/false) properties on component instances in bulk. Great for managing design systems and quickly making variations of layouts when your components have shared properties.


Usage

  • Add properties that you want to toggle (ex. “dark mode”)
  • Toggle properties to the state you want to set
  • Apply changes to the entire page, or your current selection


Examples

  • Add a notch property and variants to your components and use Property Toggle to quickly swap between iPhone 13 and iPhone SE layouts
  • Add a dark mode property and variants to your components and use Property Toggle to quickly see what your layout will look like for users who use different preferences
  • Add an android property and variants to your components and use Property Toggle to quickly switch out platform-specific UI patterns to make your devs happy
  • Add an accessibility mode property and variants to your components and use Property Toggle to quickly test what larger font sizes and higher contrast colours would look like in your layout
  • When building design ‘molecules’ in your design system from design ‘atoms’ with shared properties, quickly create variants by switching all nested instances at the same time.

accepted.name: Evan Dinsmore
accepted.description:
Design Lead @Delphia

Toronto-based multidisciplinary designer with a passion for branding, systems, and mobile product design.

plugins.name: Select all instances
plugins.description:
A plugin for component instance inspection and selection.


Better manage the use of any component library, find missing main components, fine tune your selections for editing (eg: avoid nested instances), make large selections and act on it (Select > Detach).


Features

  • Flexible instance selection: adjust the filters > select all instances.
  • Inspect main component info for each instance: local/remote, existing/missing.
  • Search by term: exact match with `"term"` or `"term`).
  • Search in current selection to find children instances for any node type: sections, frames, etc.
  • Filter out nested instances: allows working only with instances inside main. components, so that nested ones can inherit the changes without overrides.
  • Filter visible/hidden instances.
  • Filter up-to-date/outdated instances.
  • Filter local/remote components.
  • Filter missing/existing components.


🙏 If you find this plugin useful please consider sponsoring my work: https://github.com/sponsors/morekid


Fancy a feature? Add a request.


GitHub
plugins.tagline: Swiss army knife for component instance inspection and selection.

plugins.name: Android / iOS Converter
plugins.description:
⚠️ To use the plugin, you must be on a team with a Professional plan to have access to shared component libraries.


👉 Installation


Step 1

To use the plugin, you have to enter your Access Token. You can revoke access at any time.

  1. Login to your Figma account.
  2. Head to the "account settings" from the top-left a Figma menu.
  3. Find the personal access tokens section.
  4. Click "Create new token"
  5. A token will be generated. This will be your only chance to copy the token, so make sure you keep a copy of this in a secure place.


Step 2

Enter link to your Team ID, eg https://www.figma.com/files/team/1234

  1. Open your Figma account and click on the "Teams" tab in the left sidebar.
  2. Right-click on the team you want to add
  3. Click "Copy link"
  4. Link will be copied to clipboard


👉 Component replacement rule settings


To use the plugin, you must be on a team with a Professional plan to have access to shared component libraries.

Go to figma.com, open your team profile through the menu on the left by clicking on the team name highlighted in bold.

Copy the team ID from the address bar into the field below: https://www.figma.com/files/team/[team ID]/[team name]

Example: Button = Button


👉 Text replacement rule settings

You can set up text style replacement rules synchronization for your Figma team

by creating a regular fig file called “ANDROID_IOS_CONVERTER_TEXT_RULES” inside any team project and give read access to all members.

Create a text element and write down the rules as pictured inside the file.

Enter the name of the text style from the Android library and its counterpart from the iOS library through “=”.

Android on the left, iOS on the right. After that, the rules will automatically be synchronized every time you open Android / iOS Converter.
plugins.tagline: Fast and easy convert layouts, texts and components from Android to iOS and back

plugins.name: Automater
plugins.description:
A bunch of commands collected into a plugin.


Features

  1. add interactions in series: connects all frames in sequence by position (Z flow)
  2. add autolayout to each layer: works best with groups or frames
  3. align multiple layers at once
  4. adjust image sizing of multiple layers
  5. add constraints to the "Quick actions..." menu
  6. object related actions, like: bulk group, frame, flatten, boolean, flip or reset flip
  7. select layers, including previous and next siblings: works with multiple layers
  8. basic transform for text characters


Recent major changes

  1. The paste commands have been upgraded and are now available in a dedicated plugin called Paster.
  2. Resize selection has also been enhanced and is not part of a dedicated plugin called Resizer.
  3. Set constraints have been removed. Recommend Quick Constraints by Gleb instead.


Known issues

  1. "Transform text > Title case" is not an actual proper title case.


Keyboard shortcuts

You have to assign them, and it works only on macOS.

  1. Control-Comma (,): Select previous siblings
  2. Control-Period (.): Select next siblings

plugins.name: EyeQuant Inspect
plugins.description:
Is the button visible enough? Is my design too cluttered? Is the content in the right place?


Instantly see how users will respond to your designs - as early as a high fidelity wireframe or prototype - so you know what works and what doesn’t, before you go live. 


EyeQuant is an essential product for designers to create more successful digital experiences and maximise design performance. 


Features 


  1. Attention Heatmaps 
  2. Clarity scores 
  3. Excitingness scores 
  4. Regions of Interest 


How does the EyeQuant plugin work?


  1. Select the Figma frame you want to analyse
  2. Go to Plugins > EyeQuant Inspect > Analyse 
  3. View the results


If you don’t have an EyeQuant account, you can try for free.


The Tech 


EyeQuant’s technology fuses AI and neuroscience to simulate a 200-person study in seconds, giving you instant, actionable results. 


It is the result of more than a decade of institutional academic research by leading neuro and data scientists at CalTech and the University of Osnabrück.


See more here —> https://www.eyequant.com/how/


Want to help improve this plugin? Send us your feedback → support@eyequant.com
plugins.tagline: Data driven design

plugins.name: Text Edit
plugins.description:
Edit all of your text in one place.

To use Text Edit, run the plugin on a page that you'd like to edit. Text Edit will show you an alphabetically sorted list of all text layers on your current page. You can now edit all of the text directly from the plugin.

Text layers that have the same content will be merged into a single item in the list.

If you make changes on the canvas while the plugin is running, press the "Resync changes made on the canvas" button to update the list to reflect your updates.

plugins.name: Sort on Canvas by Name
plugins.description:
Changes positions of frames, components or other objects on canvas by name. Unlike other plugins that only order frames or other layers by name in the layers panel, this plugin can organize them by name on the canvas. However, the plugin will also arrange layers by name if they all belong to one parent element.


How to use

  1. Select layers you want to sort. Preferably they should belong to one parent but anything will work. Run the plugin, it will sort your layers.
  2. You can also select nothing, in this case plugin will automatically find all frames (only frames) on the page and sort them.


If something is broken or you have feedback, feel free to reach out via support contact on the right side of this page.

https://github.com/loitran1995/FigmaPlugin/

plugins.name: CSS Extractor
plugins.description:
CSS Extractor - Figma To CSS

Introducing the CSS Extractor, a powerful Figma plugin that simplifies the process of extracting CSS styles from your design elements.

Transform your Figma design workflow with the Figma CSS Extractor Plugin, a powerful tool that simplifies the process of extracting CSS styles from Figma elements.


Buy Me A Coffee

https://www.buymeacoffee.com/usamarajpoot

Portfolio:

https://usamarajpoot.vercel.app/

Github

https://github.com/usamarajpoot403/


Key Features:

  • Effortless Extraction: Instantly extract CSS styles from any Figma element.
  • Clean Code Output: Generate well-organized and readable CSS code.
  • Time-Saving: Streamline your design-to-code process for web development.


How It Works:

  • 1. Select any element in your Figma design.
  • 2. Run the plugin to automatically extract its CSS styles.
  • 3. Copy and paste the generated CSS code into your project.


Benefits:

  • Seamless Integration: Integrate extracted styles directly into your web development projects.
  • Consistency: Ensure design-to-code consistency with accurate CSS representation.
  • Enhanced Collaboration: Facilitate collaboration between designers and developers.


Technical Details:

  • Technology: Developed using HTML, CSS, JS and Figma Api.
  • Compatibility: Compatible with the latest versions of Figma.


Results:

Experience a smoother design handoff process and accelerate your web development workflow with the Figma CSS Extractor Plugin.


Stay tuned for updates!

plugins.name: 한글더미
plugins.description:
디자인하다가 귀찮아서 디자이너가 직접 개발한 플러그인입니다.

UI 디자인 작업 중 번거로운 더미 데이터 입력, 이제 클릭 몇 번으로 해결하세요. 한글 더미 텍스트부터 숫자, 날짜 및 시간 데이터까지 손쉽게 생성하고, 정렬과 커스텀 기능을 활용해 깔끔하고 체계적인 작업을 완성해보세요.


주요 기능

1. 텍스트 / 숫자 / 날짜 및 시간 데이터 지원

텍스트뿐만 아니라 숫자, 날짜, 시간 데이터를 한 번에 생성할 수 있어 다양한 작업 상황에 활용 가능합니다.


2. 검색 기능 추가

더 많은 텍스트 타입이 추가되었지만, 검색 기능을 통해 원하는 데이터를 빠르게 찾아 사용할 수 있습니다.


3. 텍스트 타입 확장

다양한 주제별 텍스트 타입이 추가되었습니다.

예: 프로필, 여행, 뉴스 등 상황에 맞는 더미 콘텐츠를 쉽게 선택할 수 있습니다.


4. 정렬 기능 추가

생성된 데이터를 오름차순, 내림차순, 랜덤으로 정렬할 수 있어 데이터를 깔끔하게 정리하고 효율적인 작업을 지원합니다.


5. 커스텀 숫자 입력

숫자 데이터를 생성할 때, 원하는 범위의 커스텀 수치를 입력해 더욱 구체적이고 필요한 데이터를 얻을 수 있습니다.


초간단 한글 더미 사용법

  1. 더미 텍스트를 적용할 한 개 혹은 여러 개의 텍스트 레이어 선택합니다.
  2. 텍스트, 숫자, 날짜 및 시간 데이터 중 원하는 타입 내의 더미를 눌러줍니다.


필요시 검색 및 정렬 기능을 활용해보세요.

인스턴스 컴포넌트에도 사용 가능합니다.


피드백 주실 내용이 있으신가요?

문의할 내용이 있다면, designbasekorea@gmail.com으로 언제든지 편하게 연락 주세요.


웹사이트 : https://designbase.co.kr/

유튜브 채널 : https://www.youtube.com/c/designbase

123722.release_notes:
새로운 기능
1. 카테고리 그룹핑 및 더미 데이터 추가
- 데이터를 보다 체계적으로 정리할 수 있도록 카테고리 그룹핑 기능이 추가되었습니다.
- 다양한 활용 사례를 고려하여 더미 데이터 N종을 새롭게 추가하였습니다.

2. 사용성 개선
- 숫자, 날짜 및 시간 데이터도 검색할 수 있도록 기능이 확장되었습니다.
- 사이드바에서 숫자, 날짜 및 시간을 보다 쉽게 선택할 수 있도록 인터페이스를 개선하였습니다.

3. 커스텀 숫자에 접두사/접미사 기능 추가
숫자 데이터를 보다 자유롭게 활용할 수 있도록 접두사(예: $, #) 및 접미사(예: %, 개) 설정 기능이 추가되었습니다.

제거된 기능
1. 목록 변경 기능 삭제

이번 업데이트를 통해 플러그인의 기능이 더욱 직관적이고 유용하게 개선되었습니다.
앞으로도 지속적인 업데이트를 통해 최적의 사용자 경험을 제공하겠습니다.

plugins.name: illustrator.to.design — by ‹div›RIOTS — Import Adobe Illustrator files (.ai) to Figma
plugins.description:
Import your Adobe Illustrator files as fully editable Figma designs.

Go directly from Illustrator to Figma and convert your .ai artboards into Figma layers!


How to import Adobe Illustrator files into Figma:

  1. Run this Figma plugin, illustrator.to.design
  2. Upload your .ai file, or drag-and-drop it into the plugin
  3. Click “Import”
  4. Your Illustrator artboard will be imported into Figma as fully-editable layers or high-res images!


Why use illustrator.to.design?

  1. Go directly from Illustrator to Figma - no additional converter tools required.
  2. Fast, high-quality conversion from Adobe Illustrator .ai to Figma to keep your designs precise.
  3. Perfect for migrating between tools or using old files for new designs!


FREE

  1. 5 imports/month


PRO License

  1. Unlimited imports
  2. Multiple files at once
  3. $49 for 1-year (not recurring) or $99 for 3-years (not recurring)

plugins.description:

image.to.design improves the import of formats natively supported by Figma:

  1. Improved SVG compatibility compared to Figma.
  2. PNG images are optimized before import to improve the memory usage and the performance of Figma.
  3. images larger than the normal 4096px limit are imported without resizes
  4. more file formats supported!

plugins.name: Style Sync
plugins.description:
Style Sync give you the ability to apply styles (color & text) to all elements with matching properties in your design files.


Requirements

  • Elements must be visible
  • Colors fills must be visible


Notes

  • Color Style: support solid fills property & opacity
  • Text Style: support (Font-Family, Font-Style, Font-Size, Line-Height, Letter-Spacing, Text-Decoration, Case)
  • Stroke Style: WIP


Know issue

  • Text Style: *Imported fonts dosent sync properly


Plugin Synergy

Pair well with Find and Replace, a plugin that give you the ability to to find all instance of a specific color and replace it by another one in your entire project files


You can support by

  • 💕 Like
  • 💬 Comment

plugins.name: Scale Better
plugins.description:
Scale by percent or exact width/height without the annoying decimal characters. This plugin makes the process of scaling super easy.


With Scale Better you can scale any number of items in your current selection by percentage, width or height. You can even scale up and down to the largest or smallest item in your selection.


With the scale factor option, round your scaling to the closest value based on your grid (for example, set scale factor to 8 to ensure your scaled elements are always divisible by 8).


You can also leverage the scale origin control for easy scaling orientation.

plugins.name: Image Compressor
plugins.description:
Batch-compress images in Figma.


If your canvas has many frames with high-definition images, Figma can lag or run out of memory. By compressing your images, you can save on memory and make your files run more smoothly.


This plugin will compress and replace your image fills automatically.


To use this plugin:

  • Select one or more objects on your Figma canvas
  • Hit the ‘scan’ button to start scanning for image fills
  • Once the scan completes, select the images you want to compress
  • Adjust your scan settings (optional)
  • Hit the ‘compress’ button to compress the selected images
  • The plugin will compress and replace the image fills selected


Notes:

  • Running this on very large files can be slow
  • It's suggested to batch a large file into smaller runs of the plugin, e.g. up to 300 images at a time, for best results


Questions?

  • Reach out to @guamhat on Twitter
  • The plugin code is open sourced here

accepted.name: Gautham 🌶
accepted.description: hi

plugins.tagline: Reduce Figma memory usage by compressing your images

plugins.name: Charts+ (by Highcharts)
plugins.description:
Welcome to the Highcharts Community!


🚀 About Highcharts Core

Highcharts Core is a powerful plugin designed for Figma that allows you to create and adjust charts seamlessly within your design environment.


Key Features:

  1. Comprehensive Chart Support: Instantly generate various chart types including line, bar, gauge, pie, and area charts.
  2. Live Resizing (New!) Charts now automatically resize as you drag the frame — no more re-generating or guesswork.
  3. Figma Slides Support (New!) Insert charts directly into Figma Slides
  4. Effortless Adjustments: Already made a chart? No problem! Update existing charts with just a few clicks to keep them up to date and consistent across your projects.
  5. User-Friendly Interface: Enjoy a simple, intuitive interface that allows you to tweak and fine-tune your charts.
  6. Local Variables for Design Systems: Leverage local variables to create and utilize design systems, allowing you to standardize chart components across different projects and ensure design consistency.
  7. Custom Data for Charts: Now you can import your own custom data directly into the plugin to generate charts. This new feature empowers users to visualize real-world data, offering more flexibility and precision in creating unique, data-driven designs.
  8. Enhanced Data Random Generator: Upgraded the data random generator for more realistic and varied data generation, improving the testing and preview experience.
  9. Collaboration with Developers: Once you've designed your charts, easily send them to developers who can integrate them with our Highcharts library. This streamlined process reduces the time and effort needed to perfect designs, ensuring your visualizations are beautiful and functional in your final product.



📣 Feedback

We are would love your feedback. Share your thoughts, experiences and suggestions in the comments section, or reach out directly via email at figmasupport@highsoft.com. Your input is invaluable and helps us shape the future of Highcharts Core.


🤝 Figma Plugin Development Team

The Highcharts Core Figma plugin was developed by Black Label and Highsoft. Black Label has been the dedicated support and development team for Highcharts and Highsoft for over a decade.


Thank you for being part of our community and helping us build a tool designers love!
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly create and edit charts in Figma.

plugins.name: Randomise colour
plugins.description:
Randomise colour - Premium color randomization straight outta Europe, for your viewing pleasure!


Applies colour variations to selected objects (Everything with solid fill, stroke or gradients works, including text). Great for creating an organic, handmade look, or wild patterns.


Applies variations using normal distribution, with original colour as mean, and distance setting as sigma, sometimes resulting in extreme outliers. Selected object's original colours are cached as long as the plugin is open.


Options:

  • Hue distance from original colour
  • Saturation distance from original colour
  • Lightness distance from original colour
  • Opacity distance from original colour
  • Include fills
  • Include strokes
  • Include gradients

plugins.description:
Shape Builder Tool can help you quickly complete the shape creation work. Shape creation mainly supports two modes, ADD mode (+ icon) and SUB mode (- icon)


The Replace Selection button will use the shape created by the Shape Builder Tool to replace the selected shape at the original position.

The Copy To Canvas button will place the created image next to the original selected shape.


You can use cmd+z (MacOS) / ctrl + z (Win) to undo operations, and use cmd + shift + z (MacOS) / ctrl + shift + z (Win) to redo operations.

plugins.name: Icon Scaling Tool
plugins.description:
Creating multiple sizes of icons is easy with the Microsoft Design Icon Scaling tool


With this plugin you can:


- Draw once and scale to multiple sizes with a single click

- Apply the Fluent Design System weight to icons, at the right sizes

- Check for naming, duplicates, and sizing errors with your icon sets before you export

- Correct errors on your Figma canvas and regenerate icon sizes with updates

- Inspect your icon in the tool to ensure it lands on the grid

- Ensure icons pass the even-odd fill rule and have non-zero winding with a built-in tool to correct

- Prepare your set for export as a .zip file that contains SVGs, PDFs, and a text description


Notes:


- We recommend that you start your icon design size at 24px for best results

- Icon layer names should follow the naming convention of Name / Size / Theme. For example, 'Folder / 24 / Regular'

- Using 'Thin' weight will apply a 1 px stroke to all icon sizes. 'Regular' weight will adhere to Fluent Design System rules for icons


Usage:


The Icon Scaling tool uses Fill Rule Editor for even odd error inspection under MIT license.


Thanks:


This tool was created by the Meta-Design Studio for Microsoft Design. Thanks to Prasanna Gunuru, Spencer Nelson, Jason Custer, Damien Aistrope and Zann St Pierre.

Looking for a fun way to share customised memes with your team mates? We, the folks at Zeta, built the FigMeme plugin to satisfy our need to always be meme-ready. We pride ourselves on our culture of conversing extensively using funny GIFs and sarcastic memes.


Here’s why FigMeme is awesome:

  • Search using a keyword: Can’t find the perfect meme yet? Explore the meme-verse using a keyword.
  • Get customised memes in seconds: Edit your meme with captions and customise them with different typefaces, colours and strokes.
  • Save your favourites: Easily access your go-to memes by ‘adding to favourite’.
  • Keep up with trends: Be up to date with your meme-game by seeing what’s trending.
  • ‘I’m feeling unlucky’: Not sure what you’re looking for ? Don’t sweat it, we’ll pick one for you.

• Export as React components - no more design-to-code translation issues (Beta Release)

• Enable multiple simultaneous interactions (impossible in Figma alone)

• Work seamlessly between Figma and Phase with automatically organized interactions

• Professional animation tools: keyframes, motion paths, easing curves, and animation presets

• Real-time collaboration with developers and stakeholders


Join thousands of designers who bridge the gap between design and development! 🚀


Getting started is incredibly simple:

1 Select your design - Choose frames, components, or groups to export

2 Click Import - Phase allows you to choose to turn your variants into interactions (Please note that nested components are not yet supported due to Figma's flattened component system, but we're working on it! :-)

3 Open in Phase - Your designs are ready with interactions converted to Actions

4 Enhance & Export - Add animations and export as code or media files


If you like learning with videos, checkout our demo: https://youtu.be/dn8JnLu-KqI


Features

🎯 Design to Code, Seamlessly

Unlike other prototyping tools, Phase exports your animations and interactions as production-ready React components. What you design is what gets built.

⚡ Multiple Simultaneous Interactions

Break free from Figma's limitations. Run multiple animations and interactions at the same time - just like in real applications.

🎨 Professional Animation Control

• Keyframes - Precise control over every animation property

• Path Animations - Motion paths for curved movements, trim paths for draw-on effects, and path morphing for shape transformations

• Animation Presets - ready-to-use animation effects (fade, scale, spin, trim, and more)

• Advanced Easing - Bezier curves, elastic, bounce, and custom easing


🔄 Import your Figma Interactions

You can choose to convert your Interactive components from Figma to Phase Actions.

🚀 Export Options That Matter

• React Components - Production-ready code

• Lottie - Lightweight animations for web and mobile

• Video/GIF - For presentations and social media

• dotLottie - Compressed animations with smaller file sizes


👥 Built for Teams

• Real-time collaboration with multi-cursor support

• Version history and commenting

• Share prototypes with stakeholders instantly


What makes Phase different?

From Design to Development

While other tools stop at visual prototypes, Phase generates actual code. Your beautiful interactions become real features, not just demos.

True Interactivity

Create conditional logic, decision-based flows, and complex user journeys. Phase combines visual design with programming logic.

Developer-Friendly

No more "lost in translation" between design and development. Developers receive clean, organized React components they can actually use.


Current Limitations

We believe in transparency. Here's what to expect:

• Borders become centered in Phase

• Text underlines and emojis aren't supported yet

• Blur/shadow effects may appear differently

• Polygons convert to paths

• Code export doesn’t support booleans and some animations yet because translating the canvas into code is really hard.. we’re working on it and shipping fast!

•We can’t yet support importing nested components because Figma’s flattened design system is not compatible, we’re figuring out a workaround!


These limitations are temporary as we continuously improve the plugin.


FAQ

Can I use Phase without coding knowledge?

Absolutely! Phase is designed for designers. The code export is a bonus for developer handoff, but you never need to write code yourself.

What happens to my Figma interactions?

They're automatically converted to Phase Actions, ready for enhancement with advanced animations.

Can I collaborate with my team?

Yes! Phase supports real-time collaboration, commenting, and version history. Share via restricted links, remix links, or prototype-only links.

What export formats are supported?

• Code: React components with CSS & JavaScript (Beta Release)

• Animation: GIF, MP4, Lottie (.json), dotLottie (.lottie)

• All exports maintain your animation timing and interactions

Is it free to try?

Yes! Phase is free to use.


We're here to help you succeed:

📧 Email: support@phase.com

💬 Community: Join our community: https://community.phase.com/c/questions/


⠀

Ready to ship real interactions? Import your designs to Phase and bridge the gap between design and development today! ✨
